alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 1:42AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by runoff from heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northeastern Somerset County. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Minor flooding is occurring along Stony Brook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain fell in northeastern Somerset County. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... North Plainfield and Watchung. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 40 and 42. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
